docs.snippet: A prisoner in Uruguay tapped into the American ambassador’s cellphone and tried to commit fraud, the authorities said Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: A prisoner in Uruguay tapped into the American ambassador’s cellphone and tried to commit fraud, the authorities said Tuesday.
docs.abstract: Authorities in Uruguay report that a prison inmate tapped into the cellphone of United States Ambassador Julissa Reynoso and tried to commit fraud.

headline.main: Uruguay: Inmate Tapped Into U.S. Ambassador’s Phone
headline.print_headline: Uruguay: Inmate Tapped Into Ambassador’s Phone

docs.snippet: Wayne Rooney expects to be in peak condition when he embarks on his third World Cup finals campaign next month and is excited by the potential of the young talent in the England squad.

docs.snippet: England manager Roy Hodgson should be brave and let his young guns off the leash at the World Cup in Brazil, according to former striker Michael Owen.

docs.snippet: The Bank of England dampened expectations Wednesday that interest rates in the U.K. will be raised imminently as Governor Mark Carney said the country's economy has only begun heading back to normal.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bank of England dampened expectations Wednesday that interest rates in the U.K. will be raised imminently as Governor Mark Carney said the country's economy has only begun heading back to normal.

docs.snippet: The first legal same-sex weddings in the U.S. were held 10 years ago Saturday in Massachusetts. Since then, more than a dozen states and Washington, D.C., have followed suit, though opposition remains stiff in many other places. Some questions and...
docs.lead_paragraph: The first legal same-sex weddings in the U.S. were held 10 years ago Saturday in Massachusetts. Since then, more than a dozen states and Washington, D.C., have followed suit, though opposition remains stiff in many other places. Some questions and answers about the issue:

headline.main: Questions and Answers About Same-Sex Marriage

docs.snippet: Barcelona and Lionel Messi have agreed an improved contract that will reportedly make the four-times World Player of the Year football's best-paid player with a net annual salary of 20 million euros $27.4 million (16.2 million pounds).
docs.lead_paragraph: Barcelona and Lionel Messi have agreed an improved contract that will reportedly make the four-times World Player of the Year football's best-paid player with a net annual salary of 20 million euros $27.4 million (16.2 million pounds).

headline.main: Barca's Messi to Be World's Highest-Paid Footballer

docs.snippet: Brazil is the clear-cut favorite to win a sixth World Cup title, confirming on home turf its reputation as a soccer superpower, according to a global survey of over 120 football-loving market analysts polled by Reuters.
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil is the clear-cut favorite to win a sixth World Cup title, confirming on home turf its reputation as a soccer superpower, according to a global survey of over 120 football-loving market analysts polled by Reuters.

headline.main: Brazil Clear Favorite to Win World Cup, Financial Analysts Say
headline.print_headline: Brazil Clear Favorite to Win World Cup, Financial Analysts Say

docs.snippet: A federal judge in Washington ordered the U.S. military on Friday to at least temporarily stop force-feeding a hunger striking prisoner at the Guantanamo Bay naval base.
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Washington ordered the U.S. military on Friday to at least temporarily stop force-feeding a hunger striking prisoner at the Guantanamo Bay naval base.

headline.main: US Ordered Not to Force Feed Guantanamo Prisoner
headline.print_headline: US Ordered Not to Force Feed Guantanamo Prisoner

docs.snippet: The ruling also ordered the military not to destroy videotapes showing previous force-feeding of the detainee, who is on a hunger strike.
docs.lead_paragraph: The ruling also ordered the military not to destroy videotapes showing previous force-feeding of the detainee, who is on a hunger strike.
docs.abstract: Federal Judge Gladys Kessler orders the military to stop force-feeding Jihad Ahmed Mujstafa Diyab, a hunger-striking detainee at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba; in order, first of its kind, Kessler also orders military not to destroy videotapes showing previous force-feeding of Diyab.

headline.main: Judge Orders U.S. to Stop Force-Feeding Syrian Held at Guantánamo
headline.print_headline: Military Ordered to Stop Force-Feeding Detainee

docs.snippet: Lille finished third in Ligue 1 and snatched the remaining Champions League qualification spot after Salomon Kalou scored twice in a 4-1 win at Lorient in the final round of matches on Saturday.

headline.main: Lille Clinch Last Champions League Spot in Ligue 1
